intro: Didiscus tenuifolius, commonly known as the slender-leaf didiscus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features opposite, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences, typically displaying white or pale yellow petals. Didiscus tenuifolius is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
